review: Works well, easy setup, still waiting on more third-party app support, but the product itself is amazing. This is one product everyone should have.

review: Hmmm. I'm having mixed emotions. It's great! I can stream Pandora to my TV with chromecast, wait i can already do that with my sony Blu Ray. It sucks! It makes You Tube full screen if I use the chrome browser... not a lot of value added there. On the plus side, I can mirror my laptop to my tv using chrome. Set up is easy and intuitive. I have not taken the device on a business trip yet...
author: Zipdog

review: Works GREAT for the features it has so far. Hulu+ working now. Can't wait for more apps to get on board like Twitch and HBOgo, but great so far.
author: Wyered1

review: Great for Netflix, Youtube, and Google Play Movies. Casting a tab in Chrome works great from my new Mac, but is choppy on my old, slow Mac. Despite that problem, I prefer the Chromecast over Roku and Apple TV.
author: B. Alexander

review: This is a great device, it helps when the kids want to watch tv and you are in another section of your house. No more trying to find a channel or program.
author: Martín Altamirano

review: This thing is an epic failure. I picked it up in the hopes of being able to stream web programing to my TV. I got it up an running but when it came to stream it was a no go since Google does not support MS Sliverlight and of course the web programing I wanted to stream is using MS SIlverlight. And since I already have a PS3 and the Roku there was no reason to keep this device, so I packed it up and returned it to Best Buy. This device is a great idea in theory but the execution of it is sad with its limited app support and no MS Silverlight support.
author: Vixen "groovey"

review: disappointed with how impossibly difficult it is to connect Netflix to TV  using Silverlight.....still not done....any other options...no problems with You Tube...computer is a Mac
author: Raj Mitta

review: If you're thinking about purchasing a Google Chromecast, make your purchase today as this is my 3rd Chromecast that I purchased - One for every TV as it is a must have product. You can't beat $35 and stream most of your favorite content. I have my power cable plugged into the outlet instead to the USB port on the TV as this allows me to turn my TV on once I hit the CAST button on my phone/laptop.I also had multiple people at my house all casting content from youtube to my TV to listen to favorite music videos and such. A must have.
author: Ruslan Parsegyan
